events.message: The insured filed a claim after their car was involved in a collision at an intersection, causing substantial damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after review of the incident details and involved vehicle damage.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim to ensure timely processing.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment notification to the claimant confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Requested copies of the police report, vehicle damage photos, and repair estimates from the claimant for further evaluation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report and repair shop estimates ahead of deadline.
An investigation commenced to verify the circumstances of the vehicle accident and assess liability and damages.
Investigation finalized confirming fault and validating the extent of the vehicle damage as reported by the claimant.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering full repair costs of the claimant's vehicle subject to claimant agreement.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling.
Formal approval of the claim was granted reflecting agreement to proceed with the settlement payment to the insured.
The settlement payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s preferred bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation of the repair completion and receipt of all payment documents.
All claim files and documentation were archived in compliance with company protocols for record retention.
